data.title: Mining company tied to Cambodian military officials grabs community forest - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Community members say the company, Lin Vatey, is logging the forest, while community members who have complained or resisted have faced persecution by the authorities.

data.title: China’s warships gift and funding naval base in Cambodia: Could it put regional dynamics in choppy waters? - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Analysts say the twin moves could be part of a deal to secure China preferential rights to use Ream Naval Base in southern Cambodia. The question is how much access China will have to the military installation, and to what ends.

data.title: Candid Conversation: Cambodia’s Ken Loo - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Despite a series of setbacks over the past years, the Cambodian apparel exports have finally made some progress in the first five months of 2024, with exports up by more than 22 percent over the previous year.

data.title: Meet the 12-year-old Cambodian princess who apparently wants to become a K-pop idol - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodian princess Jenna Norodom is reportedly considering becoming a trainee in Korea to debut as an idol, according to a Taiwanese news outlet. The 12-year-old princess is already a celebrity in her home country, with millions of followers on various social media platforms. “12-year-old Cambodian princess Jenna Norodom, a celebrity in Cambodia’s entertainment industry, plans […]

data.title: Cambodia says it would welcome US Navy at port expanded with China's help - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia said on Tuesday the U.S. Navy would be welcome to visit its Ream Naval Base, which the Pentagon is concerned will become a Chinese outpost.

data.title: Tourists taking part in ‘Temple Run challenge’ at historic Cambodian Unesco site receive backlash - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Conservationists and academics have condemned the trend as a ‘disaster waiting to happen’.

data.title: The Sanctioning of Ly Yong Phat: Milestone or Mirage? - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Will new U.S. sanctions on one of Cambodia’s most prominent state-affiliated kingpins signal a turning point for Cambodian state organized crime?

data.title: Angkor Plywood, the ‘timber cartel’ shipping Cambodian forests internationally - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: A year-long Mongabay investigation shows that one of Cambodia’s most notorious logging companies likely illegally exported rare tree species to Vietnam and China for years.

data.title: ​New BAKC president vows reforms to strengthen legal profession​
data.description: ​​New BAKC president vows reforms to strengthen legal profession​

data.title: How a Chef’s Homestay Near Phnom Penh Is Preserving Cambodia’s Culinary Heritage - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Travelers learn about Cambodia’s traditional dishes at a chef's home — and help save them from extinction.

data.title: Why Is China Investing In a $1.7 Billion Canal in Cambodia? - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The Funan Techo Canal is the latest in a string of flashy Chinese investments in Cambodia. How did Cambodia, a lower-middle-income nation of 17.5 million people, become a focal point of Chinese foreign policy and investment?

data.title: China’s growing infrastructure projects in Cambodia and their geostrategic implications - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: With talk of China possibly looking at Ream Naval Base as its second overseas military base after Djibouti, US academic Chen Xiangming notes that coupling a new canal with even a periodic naval visit at Ream would allow China to monitor the critical shipping lane of the Strait of Malacca from a close geostrategic point.

data.title: Revived Cambodian Nationalism Threatens to Undermine ‘Special’ Relationship With Vietnam - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Anti-Vietnamese resentment has spelled an end to a cross-border cooperation agreement with Vietnam and Laos.

data.title: Can the Thai-Cambodian heritage conflict end? - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: While Thailand and Cambodia share borders, a long history and numerous cultural similarities – religion, architecture, language, and martial arts to name but a few – these common threads have, ironically, become a source of tension in recent years.

data.title: Cambodian trade union leader Chhim Sithar, released from prison: “We must keep speaking out and uniting for our rights” - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: In a conversation with Equal Times, Chhim Sithar discusses her commitment to defending workers’ rights in Cambodia, her years of detention, and what her future holds – particularly whether her plans may involve the still unresolved labour conflict at NagaWorld. Phnom Penh, 2019.
